summary: Build 'SBA Grant Administration' — a professional, government-style global grant application website with a public application form, applicant status tracker (via Application ID), and an admin dashboard to review applications, manage processing fees, and configure payment receiving accounts (bank/crypto).
architectural_notes: Public visitors should not see an Admin Login control on the homepage/public site; admin access should be moved to a dedicated /admin route (or otherwise not exposed in the public header) while keeping admin authentication available for authorized users.
known_issues: Admin login button intermittently disappears on the public/main site, making the site look unreliable/risky to visitors.
Admin Login button is currently visible to public visitors on the homepage; it should not be exposed in the public UI.

existing_features.title: Create a public homepage for “SBA Grant Administration” that includes a grant application form collecting: full name, email, country, and requested amount restricted to $5,000–$50,000 (inclusive). Submitting the form must create a new application and return a unique Application ID to the applicant.

Implement an applicant status tracker page/section where applicants can enter their Application ID to view current application status. If approved, the tracker must also show the assigned processing fee and payment instructions (based on the receiving account chosen by admin).
Build an admin dashboard UI to review submitted applications: list and search by Application ID, view full application details, and take actions to approve or reject applications.
Add admin capabilities to assign a processing fee to an application (as a numeric USD amount) and ensure approved applicants can see the fee in the status tracker once assigned.

Implement admin management of receiving accounts used for payment instructions. Admin must be able to create, edit, and select receiving accounts of type Bank or Crypto with full details stored and shown to approved applicants as payment instructions.

Restrict admin dashboard and admin backend methods to authorized administrators only (using Internet Identity authentication), and provide an in-app “Not authorized” state for non-admin users who attempt to access admin pages.

Apply a consistent, official, professional, trustworthy government-style visual theme suitable for a global audience across all pages (public form, status tracker, and admin dashboard), including typography, spacing, and accessible color contrast (avoid blue/purple as primary brand colors).
Generate and include official-looking static brand assets and wire them into the UI from the frontend public assets folder.

Ensure the header’s authentication control (the "Admin Login" / "Logout" button) is always visible and does not disappear on the public/main site, including during initial auth/role loading, route changes, and responsive layouts.

Add a lightweight UI fallback to prevent perceived "disappearing" due to asynchronous admin-status checks (e.g., when the identity is present but admin status is still loading), ensuring the header layout remains stable.

Update the site header so that the "Admin Login" button is not visible to public visitors on public pages (e.g., the homepage and status tracker). The authentication control may still be shown when the user is already authenticated (to allow "Logout") and/or when the user is on an /admin route so administrators have a place to sign in.

Update admin UI wording to match a simple “Admin Portal” concept: rename user-facing labels from “Receiving Accounts” to “Payment Methods” (or “Payment Accounts”) across admin navigation and pages, while keeping the existing /admin/accounts route unchanged.
Add an obvious “Payment Methods” entry point inside the Admin Dashboard page so admins can quickly access where they insert/edit payment details for fees.

new_feature_requests.summary: Public homepage with grant application form (full name, email, country, requested amount $5,000–$50,000)
Generate and provide an Application ID for each submission
Applicant status tracker page using Application ID to view application status
Admin dashboard to list/review applications and approve or reject submissions
Admin can set/assign a processing fee per approved application
Admin can create/edit receiving accounts for payments (Bank or Crypto) with full details
Approved applicants can view their assigned processing fee and payment instructions
Official, professional, trustworthy government-style UI suitable for a global audience

Create backend data models and canister methods to support: creating applications, generating unique Application IDs, retrieving application status by Application ID, listing applications for admin review, and updating applications (approve/reject, assign processing fee, and select receiving account).
